page.title: 03Ecology - Hittisleigh
page.content: The wooded northern foothills of Dartmoor have changed perhaps the least over the passing years. The close network of small rural roads are quite well-maintained and through the increase in time for leisure today, the area has been opened for walking, and the enjoyment and study of wildlife and its conservation. The Two-Moors Way, a footpath crossing from Dartmoor to Exmoor, winds its way through the region using some ancient tracks as well as the small rural roads. There are many relics of the old deciduous woodland, mainly oak; their associated habits provide not only interest for residents and visitors alike but also havens where all forms of wildlife can be discovered and can continue to live relatively undisturbed.
